definition: Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
short name for Fujian province 福建[Fu2 jian4]/also pr. [Min2]

sentences.english: The official languages of Taipei Atrium Toastmasters Club are English and Taiwanese.
sentences.chinese: 台北在行演讲会的会议语言是英语与闽南语。

sentences.english: Who is going to inference Minnan dialect region consumers?
sentences.chinese: 谁来影响闽南语区域的消费者？

sentences.english: Modern Teochew evolved from the more archaic Min-Nan.
sentences.chinese: 现代的潮语系由古闽南语所演化而成。

sentences.english: In Southern Min languages, such as Teochew, prenasalized stops are also found.
sentences.chinese: 在闽南语里，比如潮州方言，同样有鼻冠塞音的存在。

definition: Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
Min dialects, spoken in Fujian Province, Taiwan etc
fashionable word or phrase/abbr. for 潮流用語|潮流用语[chao2 liu2 yong4 yu3]
the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters

Chinese language (Mandarin), emphasizing its national nature/Chinese as a primary or secondary school subject/Chinese in the context of the Nationalist Government/Guoyu, book of historical narrative c. 10th-5th century BC
Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
type of opera from Taiwan and Fujian
